intro: Sinosenecio globigerus var. globigerus, commonly known as the globigerous sinosenecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough or hairy texture, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white or yellow. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
